@overrides(Layout)
def updateLayout(self, width, height): 
150    @overrides(Layout)
151    def updateLayout(self, width, height):
152        """
153        Update the layout of the panel's child elements using its layout manager.
154
155        Args:
156            width (int): New width for the layout area.
157            height (int): New height for the layout area.
158        """
159        if self.layoutmanager is not None:
160            self.layoutmanager.setElements(self.getLayoutElements())
161            self.layoutmanager.updateLayout(
162                self.getWidth() - 10, self.getHeight() - 10
163            )

class TabPanel(SUILib.guielement.GUIElement, SUILib.guielement.Container): 
 42class TabPanel(GUIElement, Container):
 43    """
 44    Represents a tabbed panel UI element for SUILib applications.
 45
 46    The TabPanel displays multiple child panels, each accessible by a tab header at the top.
 47    Only one tab's content is visible at a time. Supports custom styles, arbitrary tab content,
 48    and integrates with the View layout system.
 49
 50    Attributes:
 51        tabs (list): List of Tab objects (each with a name and content element).
 52        selected_tab (int): Index of the currently selected tab.
 53        font (pygame.font.Font): Font used for rendering tab headers.
 54    """
 55
 56    def __init__(self, view, style: dict, tabs: list, width: int = 0, height: int = 0, x: int = 0, y: int = 0):
 57        """
 58        Initialize a new TabPanel instance.
 59
 60        Args:
 61            view: The parent View instance where this tab panel is placed.
 62            style (dict): Dictionary describing the style for the panel.
 63                See config/styles.json for details.
 64            tabs (list): List of Tab objects.
 65            width (int, optional): Width of the panel in pixels. Defaults to 0.
 66            height (int, optional): Height of the panel in pixels. Defaults to 0.
 67            x (int, optional): X coordinate of the panel. Defaults to 0.
 68            y (int, optional): Y coordinate of the panel. Defaults to 0.
 69        """
 70        GUIElement.__init__(self, view, x, y, width, height, style)
 71        self.layoutmanager = None
 72        self.selected_tab = 0
 73        self.font = pygame.font.SysFont(
 74            super().getStyle()["font_name"],
 75            super().getStyle()["font_size"],
 76            bold=super().getStyle()["font_bold"]
 77        )
 78        self.tabs = []
 79        for t in tabs:
 80            if isinstance(t, Tab):
 81                self.addTab(t)
 82
 83    def setTabs(self, tabs: list):
 84        """
 85        Set the panel's tabs.
 86
 87        Args:
 88            tabs (list): List of Tab objects.
 89        """
 90        self.tabs = []
 91        for t in tabs:
 92            if isinstance(t, Tab):
 93                self.addTab(t)
 94
 95    def setSelectedTab(self, index: int):
 96        """
 97        Set the selected tab by index.
 98
 99        Args:
100            index (int): The index of the tab to select.
101        """
102        self.selected_tab = index
103
104    def addTab(self, tab):
105        """
106        Add a new tab to the panel.
107
108        Args:
109            tab (Tab): The Tab object to add.
110        """
111        if isinstance(tab, Tab):
112            self.tabs.append(tab)
113            self.updateTabSize(tab)
114
115    def updateTabSize(self, tab):
116        """
117        Update the size of the content of a tab to match the TabPanel.
118
119        Args:
120            tab (Tab): The Tab whose content size should be updated.
121        """
122        content = tab.getContent()
123        if content is not None:
124            tab_header_height = self.font.render(
125                "W", 1, super().getStyle()["foreground_color"]
126            ).get_height() + 10
127            content.setX(0)
128            content.setY(0)
129            content.setWidth(super().getWidth())
130            content.setHeight(super().getHeight() - tab_header_height)
131            if isinstance(content, Layout) and content.getWidth() > 0 and content.getHeight() > 0:
132                content.updateLayout(0, 0)
133
134    def removeTab(self, tab):
135        """
136        Remove a tab from the panel.
137
138        Args:
139            tab (Tab): The Tab object to remove.
140        """
141        self.tabs.remove(tab)
142
143    @overrides(GUIElement)
144    def setWidth(self, width):
145        super().setWidth(width)
146        for tab in self.tabs:
147            self.updateTabSize(tab)
148
149    @overrides(GUIElement)
150    def setHeight(self, height):
151        super().setHeight(height)
152        for tab in self.tabs:
153            self.updateTabSize(tab)
154
155    @overrides(GUIElement)
156    def draw(self, view, screen):
157        if len(self.tabs) == 0:
158            return
159
160        tab_header_height = 0
161        selected_x = [0, 0]
162        x_offset = 5 + super().getX()
163        # Draw tab headers
164        for i, tab in enumerate(self.tabs):
165            if len(tab.getName()) != 0:
166                text = self.font.render(
167                    tab.getName(),
168                    1,
169                    super().getStyle()["foreground_color"]
170                )
171                tab_header_height = max(tab_header_height, text.get_height() + 10)
172                x1 = x_offset
173                x2 = x_offset + text.get_width() + 10
174                if i == self.selected_tab:
175                    pygame.draw.rect(
176                        screen,
177                        super().getStyle()["background_color"],
178                        pygame.Rect(
179                            x1,
180                            super().getY(),
181                            x2 - x1,
182                            tab_header_height
183                        )
184                    )
185                    selected_x = [x1 + 2, x2 - 1]
186                pygame.draw.lines(
187                    screen,
188                    super().getStyle()["outline_color"],
189                    False,
190                    [
191                        (x1, super().getY() + tab_header_height),
192                        (x1, super().getY()),
193                        (x2, super().getY()),
194                        (x2, super().getY() + tab_header_height)
195                    ],
196                    2
197                )
198                screen.blit(
199                    text,
200                    (x_offset + 5, 5 + super().getY())
201                )
202                x_offset += text.get_width() + 10
203
204        rect = pygame.Rect(
205            super().getX(),
206            super().getY() + tab_header_height,
207            super().getWidth(),
208            super().getHeight() - tab_header_height
209        )
210
211        # Draw tab content background
212        pygame.draw.rect(
213            screen,
214            super().getStyle()["background_color"],
215            rect,
216            border_radius=5
217        )
218        pygame.draw.rect(
219            screen,
220            super().getStyle()["outline_color"],
221            rect,
222            2,
223            border_radius=5
224        )
225        # Draw content of selected tab
226        if self.selected_tab >= 0 and self.selected_tab < len(self.tabs):
227            tab_screen = screen.subsurface(rect)
228            content = self.tabs[self.selected_tab].getContent()
229            if content is not None:
230                content.draw(view, tab_screen)
231        # Draw line under selected tab header to blend it with background
232        pygame.draw.line(
233            screen,
234            super().getStyle()["background_color"],
235            (selected_x[0], super().getY() + tab_header_height),
236            (selected_x[1], super().getY() + tab_header_height),
237            2
238        )
239
240    @overrides(GUIElement)
241    def processEvent(self, view, event):
242        # Handle tab header clicks
243        if event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
244            x_offset = 5 + super().getX()
245            for i, tab in enumerate(self.tabs):
246                if len(tab.getName()) != 0:
247                    text = self.font.render(
248                        tab.getName(),
249                        1,
250                        super().getStyle()["foreground_color"]
251                    )
252                    x1 = x_offset
253                    x2 = x_offset + text.get_width() + 10
254                    rect = pygame.Rect(
255                        x1,
256                        super().getY(),
257                        x2 - x1,
258                        text.get_height() + 10
259                    )
260                    x_offset += text.get_width() + 10
261                    if inRect(event.pos[0], event.pos[1], rect):
262                        self.selected_tab = i
263                        break
264
265        # Offset event for content (so children receive proper local coords)
266        tab_header_height = self.font.render(
267            "W", 1, super().getStyle()["foreground_color"]
268        ).get_height() + 10
269        if event.type in (pygame.MOUSEMOTION, pygame.MOUSEBUTTONUP, pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN):
270            event.pos = (
271                event.pos[0] - super().getX(),
272                event.pos[1] - super().getY() - tab_header_height
273            )
274        # Propagate event to selected tab content
275        if self.selected_tab >= 0 and self.selected_tab < len(self.tabs):
276            content = self.tabs[self.selected_tab].getContent()
277            if content is not None:
278                content.processEvent(view, event)
279        # Restore event position
280        if event.type in (pygame.MOUSEMOTION, pygame.MOUSEBUTTONUP, pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN):
281            event.pos = (
282                event.pos[0] + super().getX(),
283                event.pos[1] + super().getY() + tab_header_height
284            )
285
286    @overrides(GUIElement)
287    def update(self, view):
288        """
289        Update logic for the tab panel and its child contents.
290
291        Args:
292            view: The parent View instance.
293        """
294        for tab in self.tabs:
295            if tab.getContent() is not None:
296                tab.getContent().update(view)
297
298    @overrides(Container)
299    def getChilds(self):
300        """
301        Return the content elements of all tabs as children.
302
303        Returns:
304            list: List of tab content GUIElement objects.
305        """
306        result = []
307        for tab in self.tabs:
308            if tab.getContent() is not None:
309                result.append(tab.getContent())
310        return result

Represents a tabbed panel UI element for SUILib applications.

The TabPanel displays multiple child panels, each accessible by a tab header at the top. Only one tab's content is visible at a time. Supports custom styles, arbitrary tab content, and integrates with the View layout system.

Attributes:
  • tabs (list): List of Tab objects (each with a name and content element).
  • selected_tab (int): Index of the currently selected tab.
  • font (pygame.font.Font): Font used for rendering tab headers.

Set the content GUIElement of the tab.

class RadioButton(SUILib.guielement.GUIElement): 
 42class RadioButton(GUIElement):
 43    """
 44    Represents a radio button UI element for SUILib applications.
 45
 46    A radio button allows users to select a single option from a group. Only one radio button
 47    in a group can be checked at a time. Each radio button is associated with a label and a group,
 48    supports custom styles, click event callbacks, and integrates with the View layout system.
 49
 50    Attributes:
 51        label (Label): The label displayed next to the radio button.
 52        group (RadioButtonGroup): The group that manages the radio button's checked state.
 53        checked (bool): Indicates whether the radio button is selected.
 54        callback (callable): Function to call when the radio button is clicked/checked.
 55    """
 56
 57    def __init__(self, view, style: dict, text: str, group, size=20, x: int = 0, y: int = 0):
 58        """
 59        Initialize a new RadioButton instance.
 60
 61        Args:
 62            view: The parent View instance where this radio button is placed.
 63            style (dict): Dictionary containing style attributes for the radio button.
 64                See config/styles.json for details.
 65            text (str): Text to display as the radio button's label.
 66            group (RadioButtonGroup): Group to which this radio button belongs.
 67            size (int, optional): Diameter of the radio button in pixels. Defaults to 20.
 68            x (int, optional): X coordinate of the radio button. Defaults to 0.
 69            y (int, optional): Y coordinate of the radio button. Defaults to 0.
 70        """
 71        super().__init__(view, x, y, size, size, style)
 72        self.label = Label(view, super().getStyle()["label"], text, False, True, x, y)
 73        self.group = group
 74        group.addRadioButton(self)
 75        self.checked = False
 76        self.callback = None
 77
 78    def setText(self, text: str):
 79        """
 80        Set the text of the radio button's label.
 81
 82        Args:
 83            text (str): New label text.
 84        """
 85        if self.label is not None:
 86            self.label.setText(text)
 87
 88    def getLabel(self) -> Label:
 89        """
 90        Get the label object associated with this radio button.
 91
 92        Returns:
 93            Label: The label instance.
 94        """
 95        return self.label
 96
 97    def setCheckedEvt(self, callback):
 98        """
 99        Set the callback function to be called when the checked state changes.
100
101        Args:
102            callback (callable): Function to be invoked on check/uncheck.
103                The function should accept a single argument: the RadioButton instance.
104        """
105        self.callback = callback
106
107    def setChecked(self, checked: bool):
108        """
109        Set the checked state of this radio button.
110
111        Args:
112            checked (bool): True if the radio button should be checked, False otherwise.
113        """
114        self.checked = checked
115
116    def isChecked(self) -> bool:
117        """
118        Return whether this radio button is currently checked.
119
120        Returns:
121            bool: True if checked, False otherwise.
122        """
123        return self.checked
124
125    @overrides(GUIElement)
126    def draw(self, view, screen):
127        """
128        Render the radio button and its label onto the provided surface.
129
130        Args:
131            view: The parent View instance.
132            screen (pygame.Surface): The surface to render the radio button onto.
133        """
134        # Draw label
135        if self.label is not None:
136            self.label.setX(super().getX() + super().getWidth() + 5)
137            self.label.setY(super().getY() + super().getHeight() / 2)
138            self.label.draw(view, screen)
139        # Draw radio button circle
140        center = (
141            super().getX() + super().getWidth() / 2,
142            super().getY() + super().getWidth() / 2
143        )
144        if super().isSelected():
145            c = super().getStyle()["background_color"]
146            pygame.draw.circle(screen, colorChange(c, -0.2 if c[0] > 128 else 0.6), center, super().getWidth() / 2)
147        else:
148            pygame.draw.circle(screen, super().getStyle()["background_color"], center, super().getWidth() / 2)
149        pygame.draw.circle(screen, super().getStyle()["outline_color"], center, super().getWidth() / 2, 2)
150        # Draw check indicator if checked
151        if self.checked:
152            pygame.draw.circle(screen, super().getStyle()["foreground_color"], center, super().getWidth() / 4)
153
154    @overrides(GUIElement)
155    def processEvent(self, view, event):
156        """
157        Handle Pygame events for radio button interaction (click, hover).
158
159        Args:
160            view: The parent View instance.
161            event (pygame.event.Event): The Pygame event to process.
162        """
163        if event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
164            if inRect(event.pos[0], event.pos[1], super().getViewRect()):
165                if self.callback is not None:
166                    self.callback(self)
167                self.group.checkRadioButton(self)
168        elif event.type == pygame.MOUSEMOTION:
169            if inRect(event.pos[0], event.pos[1], super().getViewRect()):
170                super().select()
171            else:
172                super().unSelect()
173
174    @overrides(GUIElement)
175    def update(self, view):
176        """
177        Update logic for the radio button.
178
179        This method is a placeholder for future extensions; currently, it does not perform any updates.
180
181        Args:
182            view: The parent View instance.
183        """
184        pass

Represents a radio button UI element for SUILib applications.

A radio button allows users to select a single option from a group. Only one radio button in a group can be checked at a time. Each radio button is associated with a label and a group, supports custom styles, click event callbacks, and integrates with the View layout system.

Attributes:
  • label (Label): The label displayed next to the radio button.
  • group (RadioButtonGroup): The group that manages the radio button's checked state.
  • checked (bool): Indicates whether the radio button is selected.
  • callback (callable): Function to call when the radio button is clicked/checked.

class RadioButtonGroup: 
187class RadioButtonGroup:
188    """
189    Represents a group of RadioButton elements.
190
191    The RadioButtonGroup manages a collection of radio buttons,
192    ensuring that only one button in the group is checked at any time.
193
194    Attributes:
195        radiobtns (list): List of RadioButton instances in the group.
196    """
197
198    def __init__(self, radiobtns: list):
199        """
200        Initialize a new RadioButtonGroup.
201
202        Args:
203            radiobtns (list): List of RadioButton instances to add to the group.
204        """
205        self.radiobtns = []
206        for r in radiobtns:
207            if isinstance(r, RadioButton):
208                self.radiobtns.append(r)
209
210    def addRadioButton(self, radiobtn: RadioButton):
211        """
212        Add a RadioButton to this group.
213
214        Args:
215            radiobtn (RadioButton): The radio button to add.
216        """
217        if isinstance(radiobtn, RadioButton):
218            self.radiobtns.append(radiobtn)
219
220    def removeRadioButton(self, radiobtn: RadioButton):
221        """
222        Remove a RadioButton from this group.
223
224        Args:
225            radiobtn (RadioButton): The radio button to remove.
226        """
227        self.radiobtns.remove(radiobtn)
228
229    def getRadioButton(self):
230        """
231        Return the currently checked radio button in the group.
232
233        Returns:
234            RadioButton: The checked radio button, or None if none is checked.
235        """
236        for r in self.radiobtns:
237            if r.isChecked():
238                return r
239
240    def checkRadioButton(self, radiobtn: RadioButton):
241        """
242        Set the specified radio button as checked and uncheck all others in the group.
243
244        Args:
245            radiobtn (RadioButton): The radio button to check.
246        """
247        if isinstance(radiobtn, RadioButton):
248            for r in self.radiobtns:
249                if r != radiobtn:
250                    r.setChecked(False)
251                else:
252                    r.setChecked(True)

Attributes:
  • radiobtns (list): List of RadioButton instances in the group.

class Slider(SUILib.guielement.GUIElement): 
 43class Slider(GUIElement):
 44    """
 45    Represents a horizontal slider UI element for SUILib applications.
 46
 47    The Slider allows users to select a value within a specified range by dragging a handle.
 48    The slider displays its current value as a label and supports customizable formatting,
 49    min/max constraints, and a value change callback.
 50
 51    Attributes:
 52        label (Label): The label displaying the current slider value.
 53        min (float): The minimum value of the slider.
 54        max (float): The maximum value of the slider.
 55        position (float): The current x-position of the slider handle relative to the slider's width.
 56        callback (callable): Function to be called when the slider value changes.
 57        format (str): String format for the label, using '#' for percentage and '@' for the numerical value.
 58    """
 59        
 60    def __init__(self, view, style: dict, number: float, min: float, max: float, width: int = 0, height: int = 0, x: int = 0, y: int = 0):
 61        """
 62        Initialize a new Slider element.
 63
 64        Args:
 65            view: The parent View instance where this slider is placed.
 66            style (dict): Dictionary containing style attributes for the slider.
 67                See config/styles.json for details.
 68            number (float): Initial value of the slider.
 69            min (float): Minimum value of the slider.
 70            max (float): Maximum value of the slider.
 71            width (int, optional): Width of the slider in pixels. Defaults to 0.
 72            height (int, optional): Height of the slider in pixels. Defaults to 0.
 73            x (int, optional): X coordinate of the slider. Defaults to 0.
 74            y (int, optional): Y coordinate of the slider. Defaults to 0.
 75        """
 76        self.label = None
 77        super().__init__(view, x, y, width, height, style, pygame.SYSTEM_CURSOR_SIZEWE)
 78        self.label = Label(view, super().getStyle()["label"], " ", False, True)
 79        self.callback = None
 80        self.format = "@"
 81        self.min = min
 82        self.max = max
 83        self.setNumber(number)
 84
 85    def setMin(self, val: int):
 86        """
 87        Set the minimum value of the slider.
 88
 89        Args:
 90            val (float): New minimum value.
 91        """
 92        self.min = val
 93
 94    def setMax(self, val: int):
 95        """
 96        Set the maximum value of the slider.
 97
 98        Args:
 99            val (float): New maximum value.
100        """
101        self.max = val
102
103    def setOnValueChanged(self, callback):
104        """
105        Set the callback function to be called when the slider value changes.
106
107        Args:
108            callback (callable): Function to be invoked when the value changes.
109                The function receives the current slider number as an argument.
110        """
111        self.callback = callback
112
113    def getValue(self) -> int:
114        """
115        Get the percentage value (0-100) of the slider based on handle position.
116
117        Returns:
118            float: The current value as a percentage.
119        """
120        dot_radius = super().getHeight() / 2
121        return (self.position - dot_radius) / (super().getWidth() - dot_radius * 2) * 100
122
123    def getNumber(self) -> int:
124        """
125        Get the current number (min <= number <= max) represented by the slider.
126
127        Returns:
128            float: The current numerical value of the slider.
129        """
130        return self.getValue() / 100.0 * (self.max - self.min) + self.min
131
132    def setValue(self, value: int):
133        """
134        Set the slider position by percentage value (0-100).
135
136        Args:
137            value (float): The value of the slider as a percentage (0-100).
138        """
139        if value is None:
140            value = self.last_set_value
141        if value is None:
142            return
143        if value < 0 or value > 100:
144            return
145        self.last_set_value = value
146        dot_radius = super().getHeight() / 2
147        # set position
148        self.position = dot_radius + value / 100.0 * \
149            (super().getWidth() - dot_radius * 2)
150
151    def setNumber(self, value: int):
152        """
153        Set the slider using a number in the range [min, max].
154
155        Args:
156            value (float): The value to set the slider to.
157        """
158        if value <= self.max and value >= self.min:
159            value = (value - self.min) / (self.max - self.min) * 100
160            self.setValue(value)
161
162    def setLabelFormat(self, format: str):
163        """
164        Set the format string for the slider's label.
165
166        Args:
167            format (str): Format string; use '#' for percentage and '@' for numerical value.
168        """
169        self.format = format
170
171    def refreshLabel(self):
172        """
173        Update the slider label to display the current value using the format string.
174        """
175        if len(self.format) != 0:
176            txt = self.format
177            txt = txt.replace("#", '%.2f' % self.getValue())
178            txt = txt.replace("@", '%.2f' % self.getNumber())
179            self.label.setText(txt)
180
181    @overrides(GUIElement)
182    def updateViewRect(self):
183        """
184        Update the slider's label position when the view rectangle changes.
185        """
186        super().updateViewRect()
187        if self.label is not None:
188            self.label.setX(super().getX() + super().getWidth() + 20)
189            self.label.setY(super().getY() + super().getHeight() / 2)
190
191    @overrides(GUIElement)
192    def setWidth(self, width):
193        """
194        Set the width of the slider and update the handle position and label.
195        """
196        super().setWidth(width)
197        self.setValue(None)
198        self.refreshLabel()
199
200    @overrides(GUIElement)
201    def setHeight(self, height):
202        """
203        Set the height of the slider and update the handle position and label.
204        """
205        super().setHeight(height)
206        self.setValue(None)
207        self.refreshLabel()
208
209    @overrides(GUIElement)
210    def draw(self, view, screen):
211        """
212        Render the slider background, track, handle, and label.
213
214        Args:
215            view: The parent View instance.
216            screen (pygame.Surface): The surface to render the slider onto.
217        """
218        # background
219        pygame.draw.rect(screen, super().getStyle()[
220                         "background_color"], super().getViewRect(), border_radius=10)
221        # slider bar
222        pygame.draw.rect(
223            screen,
224            colorChange(super().getStyle()["foreground_color"], 0.8),
225            pygame.Rect(
226                super().getX(),
227                super().getY(),
228                self.position,
229                super().getHeight()
230            ),
231            border_radius=10
232        )
233        # outline
234        pygame.draw.rect(screen, super().getStyle()[
235                         "outline_color"], super().getViewRect(), 2, border_radius=10)
236        # slider
237        pygame.draw.circle(
238            screen,
239            super().getStyle()["foreground_color"],
240            (super().getX() + self.position,
241             super().getY() + super().getHeight() / 2),
242            super().getHeight() * 0.8
243        )
244        # label with current value
245        self.label.draw(view, screen)
246
247    @overrides(GUIElement)
248    def processEvent(self, view, event):
249        """
250        Handle Pygame events for slider interaction (dragging the handle).
251
252        Args:
253            view: The parent View instance.
254            event (pygame.event.Event): The event to process.
255        """
256        if event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
257            if math.dist(
258                (event.pos[0], event.pos[1]),
259                (super().getX() + self.position,
260                 super().getY() + super().getHeight() / 2)
261            ) <= super().getHeight() * 0.8:
262                super().select()
263                self.def_position = self.position
264                self.drag_start = event.pos[0]
265        elif event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONUP:
266            super().unSelect()
267            self.setValue(self.getValue())
268        elif event.type == pygame.MOUSEMOTION:
269            if super().isSelected():
270                self.position = self.def_position + \
271                    (event.pos[0] - self.drag_start)
272                dot_radius = super().getHeight() / 2
273                self.position = min(
274                    max(dot_radius, self.position), super().getWidth() - dot_radius)
275                self.refreshLabel()
276                if self.callback is not None:
277                    self.callback(self.getNumber())

Represents a horizontal slider UI element for SUILib applications.

The Slider allows users to select a value within a specified range by dragging a handle. The slider displays its current value as a label and supports customizable formatting, min/max constraints, and a value change callback.

Attributes:
  • label (Label): The label displaying the current slider value.
  • min (float): The minimum value of the slider.
  • max (float): The maximum value of the slider.
  • position (float): The current x-position of the slider handle relative to the slider's width.
  • callback (callable): Function to be called when the slider value changes.
  • format (str): String format for the label, using '#' for percentage and '@' for the numerical value.
Slider( view, style: dict, number: float, min: float, max: float, width: int = 0, height: int = 0, x: int = 0, y: int = 0)

62        Initialize a new Slider element.
63
64        Args:
65            view: The parent View instance where this slider is placed.
66            style (dict): Dictionary containing style attributes for the slider.
67                See config/styles.json for details.
68            number (float): Initial value of the slider.
69            min (float): Minimum value of the slider.
70            max (float): Maximum value of the slider.
71            width (int, optional): Width of the slider in pixels. Defaults to 0.
72            height (int, optional): Height of the slider in pixels. Defaults to 0.
73            x (int, optional): X coordinate of the slider. Defaults to 0.
74            y (int, optional): Y coordinate of the slider. Defaults to 0.
75        """
76        self.label = None
77        super().__init__(view, x, y, width, height, style, pygame.SYSTEM_CURSOR_SIZEWE)
78        self.label = Label(view, super().getStyle()["label"], " ", False, True)
79        self.callback = None
80        self.format = "@"
81        self.min = min
82        self.max = max
83        self.setNumber(number)

@overrides(GUIElement)
def processEvent(self, view, event): 
247    @overrides(GUIElement)
248    def processEvent(self, view, event):
249        """
250        Handle Pygame events for slider interaction (dragging the handle).
251
252        Args:
253            view: The parent View instance.
254            event (pygame.event.Event): The event to process.
255        """
256        if event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
257            if math.dist(
258                (event.pos[0], event.pos[1]),
259                (super().getX() + self.position,
260                 super().getY() + super().getHeight() / 2)
261            ) <= super().getHeight() * 0.8:
262                super().select()
263                self.def_position = self.position
264                self.drag_start = event.pos[0]
265        elif event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONUP:
266            super().unSelect()
267            self.setValue(self.getValue())
268        elif event.type == pygame.MOUSEMOTION:
269            if super().isSelected():
270                self.position = self.def_position + \
271                    (event.pos[0] - self.drag_start)
272                dot_radius = super().getHeight() / 2
273                self.position = min(
274                    max(dot_radius, self.position), super().getWidth() - dot_radius)
275                self.refreshLabel()
276                if self.callback is not None:
277                    self.callback(self.getNumber())

Arguments:
  • view: The parent View instance.
  • event (pygame.event.Event): The event to process.

class Table(SUILib.guielement.GUIElement, SUILib.guielement.Container): 
 43class Table(GUIElement, Container):
 44    """
 45    Represents a scrollable table UI element for SUILib applications.
 46
 47    The Table displays a tabular dataset with headers and rows, supports both horizontal and vertical
 48    scrolling via integrated scrollbars, and dynamically sizes columns based on content and style.
 49
 50    Attributes:
 51        header (list): List of column header strings.
 52        body (list): List of rows, each a list of cell strings.
 53        col_width (list): List of column widths in pixels.
 54        v_scroll (VerticalScrollbar): Vertical scrollbar for table body.
 55        h_scroll (HorizontalScrollbar): Horizontal scrollbar for table body.
 56        header_font (pygame.font.Font): Font for header cells.
 57        body_font (pygame.font.Font): Font for body cells.
 58        body_offset_x (float): Horizontal scroll offset.
 59        body_offset_y (float): Vertical scroll offset.
 60    """
 61
 62    def __init__(self, view, style: dict, data: dict, width: int = 0, height: int = 0, x: int = 0, y: int = 0):
 63        """
 64        Initialize a new Table element.
 65
 66        Args:
 67            view: The parent View instance where this table is placed.
 68            style (dict): Dictionary containing style attributes for the table.
 69                See config/styles.json for details.
 70            data (dict): Dictionary with table data: {"header": [...], "body": [[...], ...]}.
 71            width (int, optional): Width of the table in pixels. Defaults to 0.
 72            height (int, optional): Height of the table in pixels. Defaults to 0.
 73            x (int, optional): X coordinate of the table. Defaults to 0.
 74            y (int, optional): Y coordinate of the table. Defaults to 0.
 75        """
 76        self.last_data = None
 77        self.body_offset_x = 0
 78        self.body_offset_y = 0
 79        super().__init__(view, x, y, width, height, style)
 80        # vertical scrollbar
 81        self.v_scroll = VerticalScrollbar(
 82            view,
 83            super().getStyle()["scrollbar"],
 84            super().getStyle()["body"]["scrollbar_width"]
 85        )
 86        self.v_scroll.setOnScrollEvt(self.tableScrollVertical)
 87        # horizontal scrollbar
 88        self.h_scroll = HorizontalScrollbar(
 89            view,
 90            super().getStyle()["scrollbar"],
 91            super().getStyle()["body"]["scrollbar_width"]
 92        )
 93        self.h_scroll.setOnScrollEvt(self.tableScrollHorizontal)
 94        # initialize table data
 95        self.refreshTable(data)
 96
 97    def tableScrollVertical(self, position: float):
 98        """
 99        Handle vertical scroll event for table body.
100
101        Args:
102            position (float): Vertical position of table body (0.0 - 1.0).
103        """
104        header_height = self.header_font.get_height() * 1.8
105        total_body_data_height = header_height + self.body_font.get_height() * 1.4 * len(self.body)
106        h = super().getHeight() - super().getStyle()["body"]["scrollbar_width"]
107        self.body_offset_y = -max(0, (total_body_data_height - h)) * position
108
109    def tableScrollHorizontal(self, position: float):
110        """
111        Handle horizontal scroll event for table body.
112
113        Args:
114            position (float): Horizontal position of table body (0.0 - 1.0).
115        """
116        total_body_data_width = sum(self.col_width)
117        w = super().getWidth() - super().getStyle()["body"]["scrollbar_width"]
118        self.body_offset_x = -max(0, (total_body_data_width - w)) * position
119
120    def refreshTable(self, data: dict = None):
121        """
122        Refresh or update the table data and recompute layout.
123
124        Args:
125            data (dict, optional): Dictionary with table data: {"header": [...], "body": [[...], ...]}.
126                If None, uses the last data provided.
127        """
128        if data is None:
129            data = self.last_data
130        self.last_data = data
131        if data is None:
132            return
133
134        self.header_font = pygame.font.SysFont(
135            super().getStyle()["header"]["font_name"],
136            super().getStyle()["header"]["font_size"],
137            bold=super().getStyle()["header"]["font_bold"]
138        )
139        self.body_font = pygame.font.SysFont(
140            super().getStyle()["body"]["font_name"],
141            super().getStyle()["body"]["font_size"],
142            bold=super().getStyle()["body"]["font_bold"]
143        )
144        self.header = data["header"]
145        self.body = data["body"]
146
147        scroll_size = super().getStyle()["body"]["scrollbar_width"]
148
149        # calculate max width for each col of table
150        self.col_width = [0] * len(self.header)
151        for row in self.body:
152            for i, cell in enumerate(row):
153                self.col_width[i] = max(self.body_font.size(cell)[0] + 10, self.col_width[i])
154        for i, cell in enumerate(self.header):
155            self.col_width[i] = max(self.header_font.size(cell)[0] + 10, self.col_width[i])
156        if sum(self.col_width) <= super().getWidth() - scroll_size:
157            for i in range(len(self.header)):
158                self.col_width[i] = super().getWidth() / len(self.header)
159
160        # vertical scrollbar
161        self.v_scroll.setX(
162            super().getX() + super().getWidth() - 1 - scroll_size)
163        self.v_scroll.setY(super().getY())
164        self.v_scroll.setWidth(scroll_size)
165        self.v_scroll.setHeight(super().getHeight())
166        header_height = self.header_font.get_height() * 1.8
167        total_body_data_height = header_height + self.body_font.get_height() * 1.4 * len(self.body)
168        self.v_scroll.setScrollerSize(
169            (1.0 - max(0, total_body_data_height - super().getHeight()) / total_body_data_height) * self.v_scroll.getHeight())
170
171        # horizontal scrollbar
172        self.h_scroll.setX(super().getX())
173        self.h_scroll.setY(
174            super().getY() + super().getHeight() - 1 - scroll_size)
175        self.h_scroll.setWidth(super().getWidth() - scroll_size)
176        self.h_scroll.setHeight(scroll_size)
177        total_body_data_width = sum(self.col_width)
178        self.h_scroll.setScrollerSize(
179            (1.0 - max(0, total_body_data_width - super().getWidth()) / total_body_data_width) * self.h_scroll.getWidth())
180
181    @overrides(GUIElement)
182    def updateViewRect(self):
183        """
184        Update the table's view rectangle and refresh scrollbars and layout.
185        """
186        super().updateViewRect()
187        self.refreshTable()
188
189    @overrides(GUIElement)
190    def draw(self, view, screen):
191        """
192        Render the table, including headers, body, scrollbars, and outline.
193
194        Args:
195            view: The parent View instance.
196            screen (pygame.Surface): The surface to render the table onto.
197        """
198        # set clip
199        screen.set_clip(
200            pygame.Rect(
201                super().getX(),
202                super().getY(),
203                super().getWidth() - 1,
204                super().getHeight() - 1,
205            )
206        )
207
208        # size of table body + header
209        w = super().getWidth() - super().getStyle()["body"]["scrollbar_width"]
210        h = super().getHeight() - super().getStyle()["body"]["scrollbar_width"]
211        rect = pygame.Rect(
212            super().getX(),
213            super().getY(),
214            w,
215            h
216        )
217        # draw table body background
218        pygame.draw.rect(
219            screen,
220            super().getStyle()["body"]["background_color"],
221            rect
222        )
223        # draw col lines
224        offset = self.body_offset_x
225        for i in range(len(self.header)):
226            pygame.draw.line(
227                screen,
228                colorChange(super().getStyle()["body"]["background_color"], -0.5),
229                (super().getX() + offset, super().getY()),
230                (super().getX() + offset, super().getY() + h - 4),
231                2
232            )
233            offset += self.col_width[i]
234
235        # draw body data
236        for j, row in enumerate(self.body):
237            offset = self.body_offset_x
238            for i, cell in enumerate(row):
239                if len(cell) != 0:
240                    text = self.body_font.render(
241                        cell, 1, super().getStyle()["body"]["foreground_color"])
242                    header_offset = self.header_font.get_height() * 1.8
243                    screen.blit(
244                        text,
245                        (
246                            super().getX() + 5 + offset,
247                            super().getY() + header_offset +
248                            self.body_font.get_height() * 1.4 * j + self.body_offset_y
249                        )
250                    )
251                    offset += self.col_width[i]
252
253        # draw table header
254        if self.header is not None:
255            pygame.draw.rect(
256                screen,
257                super().getStyle()["header"]["background_color"],
258                pygame.Rect(
259                    super().getX(),
260                    super().getY(),
261                    w,
262                    self.header_font.get_height() * 1.8
263                )
264            )
265            offset = self.body_offset_x
266            for i, col in enumerate(self.header):
267                if len(col) != 0:
268                    text = self.header_font.render(
269                        col, 1, super().getStyle()["header"]["foreground_color"])
270                    screen.blit(
271                        text,
272                        (
273                            super().getX() + 5 + offset,
274                            super().getY() + self.header_font.get_height() * 0.4
275                        )
276                    )
277                    offset += self.col_width[i]
278
279        # draw v_scrollbar
280        self.v_scroll.draw(view, screen)
281        # draw h_scrollbar
282        self.h_scroll.draw(view, screen)
283
284        # draw outline
285        pygame.draw.rect(
286            screen,
287            super().getStyle()["header"]["background_color"],
288            rect,
289            2
290        )
291
292        # reset clip
293        screen.set_clip(None)
294
295    @overrides(GUIElement)
296    def processEvent(self, view, event):
297        """
298        Handle Pygame events for scrollbars.
299
300        Args:
301            view: The parent View instance.
302            event (pygame.event.Event): The event to process.
303        """

305        self.h_scroll.processEvent(view, event)

86        self.v_scroll.setOnScrollEvt(self.tableScrollVertical)
87        # horizontal scrollbar
88        self.h_scroll = HorizontalScrollbar(
89            view,
90            super().getStyle()["scrollbar"],
91            super().getStyle()["body"]["scrollbar_width"]
92        )
93        self.h_scroll.setOnScrollEvt(self.tableScrollHorizontal)
94        # initialize table data
95        self.refreshTable(data)

def tableScrollVertical(self, position: float): 
 97    def tableScrollVertical(self, position: float):
 98        """
 99        Handle vertical scroll event for table body.
100
101        Args:
102            position (float): Vertical position of table body (0.0 - 1.0).
103        """

106        h = super().getHeight() - super().getStyle()["body"]["scrollbar_width"]

115        """

117        w = super().getWidth() - super().getStyle()["body"]["scrollbar_width"]
118        self.body_offset_x = -max(0, (total_body_data_width - w)) * position

def refreshTable(self, data: dict = None): 
120    def refreshTable(self, data: dict = None):
121        """
122        Refresh or update the table data and recompute layout.
123
124        Args:
125            data (dict, optional): Dictionary with table data: {"header": [...], "body": [[...], ...]}.
126                If None, uses the last data provided.
127        """
128        if data is None:
129            data = self.last_data
130        self.last_data = data
131        if data is None:
132            return
133
134        self.header_font = pygame.font.SysFont(
135            super().getStyle()["header"]["font_name"],
136            super().getStyle()["header"]["font_size"],
137            bold=super().getStyle()["header"]["font_bold"]
138        )
139        self.body_font = pygame.font.SysFont(
140            super().getStyle()["body"]["font_name"],
141            super().getStyle()["body"]["font_size"],
142            bold=super().getStyle()["body"]["font_bold"]
143        )
144        self.header = data["header"]
145        self.body = data["body"]
146
147        scroll_size = super().getStyle()["body"]["scrollbar_width"]
148
149        # calculate max width for each col of table
150        self.col_width = [0] * len(self.header)
151        for row in self.body:
152            for i, cell in enumerate(row):
153                self.col_width[i] = max(self.body_font.size(cell)[0] + 10, self.col_width[i])
154        for i, cell in enumerate(self.header):
155            self.col_width[i] = max(self.header_font.size(cell)[0] + 10, self.col_width[i])
156        if sum(self.col_width) <= super().getWidth() - scroll_size:
157            for i in range(len(self.header)):
158                self.col_width[i] = super().getWidth() / len(self.header)
159
160        # vertical scrollbar
161        self.v_scroll.setX(
162            super().getX() + super().getWidth() - 1 - scroll_size)
163        self.v_scroll.setY(super().getY())
164        self.v_scroll.setWidth(scroll_size)
165        self.v_scroll.setHeight(super().getHeight())
166        header_height = self.header_font.get_height() * 1.8
167        total_body_data_height = header_height + self.body_font.get_height() * 1.4 * len(self.body)
168        self.v_scroll.setScrollerSize(
169            (1.0 - max(0, total_body_data_height - super().getHeight()) / total_body_data_height) * self.v_scroll.getHeight())
170
171        # horizontal scrollbar
172        self.h_scroll.setX(super().getX())
173        self.h_scroll.setY(
174            super().getY() + super().getHeight() - 1 - scroll_size)
175        self.h_scroll.setWidth(super().getWidth() - scroll_size)
176        self.h_scroll.setHeight(scroll_size)
177        total_body_data_width = sum(self.col_width)
178        self.h_scroll.setScrollerSize(
179            (1.0 - max(0, total_body_data_width - super().getWidth()) / total_body_data_width) * self.h_scroll.getWidth())

Refresh or update the table data and recompute layout.

Arguments:
  • data (dict, optional): Dictionary with table data: {"header": [...], "body": [[...], ...]}. If None, uses the last data provided.

185        """
186        super().updateViewRect()
187        self.refreshTable()

@overrides(GUIElement)
def draw(self, view, screen): 
189    @overrides(GUIElement)
190    def draw(self, view, screen):
191        """
192        Render the table, including headers, body, scrollbars, and outline.
193
194        Args:
195            view: The parent View instance.
196            screen (pygame.Surface): The surface to render the table onto.
197        """
198        # set clip
199        screen.set_clip(
200            pygame.Rect(
201                super().getX(),
202                super().getY(),
203                super().getWidth() - 1,
204                super().getHeight() - 1,
205            )
206        )
207
208        # size of table body + header
209        w = super().getWidth() - super().getStyle()["body"]["scrollbar_width"]
210        h = super().getHeight() - super().getStyle()["body"]["scrollbar_width"]
211        rect = pygame.Rect(
212            super().getX(),
213            super().getY(),
214            w,
215            h
216        )
217        # draw table body background
218        pygame.draw.rect(
219            screen,
220            super().getStyle()["body"]["background_color"],
221            rect
222        )
223        # draw col lines
224        offset = self.body_offset_x
225        for i in range(len(self.header)):
226            pygame.draw.line(
227                screen,
228                colorChange(super().getStyle()["body"]["background_color"], -0.5),
229                (super().getX() + offset, super().getY()),
230                (super().getX() + offset, super().getY() + h - 4),
231                2
232            )
233            offset += self.col_width[i]
234
235        # draw body data
236        for j, row in enumerate(self.body):
237            offset = self.body_offset_x
238            for i, cell in enumerate(row):
239                if len(cell) != 0:
240                    text = self.body_font.render(
241                        cell, 1, super().getStyle()["body"]["foreground_color"])
242                    header_offset = self.header_font.get_height() * 1.8
243                    screen.blit(
244                        text,
245                        (
246                            super().getX() + 5 + offset,
247                            super().getY() + header_offset +
248                            self.body_font.get_height() * 1.4 * j + self.body_offset_y
249                        )
250                    )
251                    offset += self.col_width[i]
252
253        # draw table header
254        if self.header is not None:
255            pygame.draw.rect(
256                screen,
257                super().getStyle()["header"]["background_color"],
258                pygame.Rect(
259                    super().getX(),
260                    super().getY(),
261                    w,
262                    self.header_font.get_height() * 1.8
263                )
264            )
265            offset = self.body_offset_x
266            for i, col in enumerate(self.header):
267                if len(col) != 0:
268                    text = self.header_font.render(
269                        col, 1, super().getStyle()["header"]["foreground_color"])
270                    screen.blit(
271                        text,
272                        (
273                            super().getX() + 5 + offset,
274                            super().getY() + self.header_font.get_height() * 0.4
275                        )
276                    )
277                    offset += self.col_width[i]
278
279        # draw v_scrollbar
280        self.v_scroll.draw(view, screen)
281        # draw h_scrollbar
282        self.h_scroll.draw(view, screen)
283
284        # draw outline
285        pygame.draw.rect(
286            screen,
287            super().getStyle()["header"]["background_color"],
288            rect,
289            2
290        )
291
292        # reset clip
293        screen.set_clip(None)

class TextInput(SUILib.guielement.GUIElement): 
 43class TextInput(GUIElement):
 44    """
 45    Represents a single-line text input UI element for SUILib applications.
 46
 47    The TextInput allows users to enter or edit a string, supports caret navigation,
 48    optional input filtering via regex, and triggers a callback when the text is changed/committed.
 49
 50    Attributes:
 51        text (str): The current text content.
 52        caret_position (int): The caret position within the text.
 53        callback (callable): Function to call when the text is changed/committed.
 54        filter_pattern (re.Pattern): Optional compiled regex for input validation.
 55        font (pygame.font.Font): Font object used for rendering the text.
 56    """
 57
 58    def __init__(self, view, style: dict, text: str, width: int = 0, height: int = 0, x: int = 0, y: int = 0):
 59        """
 60        Initialize a new TextInput element.
 61
 62        Args:
 63            view: The parent View instance where this text input is placed.
 64            style (dict): Dictionary describing the style for this element.
 65                See config/styles.json for details.
 66            text (str): Initial text for the input.
 67            width (int, optional): Width of the input in pixels. Defaults to 0.
 68            height (int, optional): Height of the input in pixels. Defaults to 0.
 69            x (int, optional): X coordinate of the input. Defaults to 0.
 70            y (int, optional): Y coordinate of the input. Defaults to 0.
 71        """
 72        super().__init__(view, x, y, width, height, style, pygame.SYSTEM_CURSOR_IBEAM)
 73        self.callback = None
 74        self.filter_pattern = None
 75        self.text = text
 76        self.caret_position = len(text)
 77        self.font = pygame.font.SysFont(
 78            super().getStyle()["font_name"],
 79            super().getStyle()["font_size"],
 80            bold=super().getStyle()["font_bold"]
 81        )
 82
 83    def setText(self, text: str):
 84        """
 85        Set the current text value.
 86
 87        Args:
 88            text (str): New text string for this input.
 89        """
 90        self.text = text
 91        self.caret_position = len(text)
 92
 93    def getText(self):
 94        """
 95        Get the current text value.
 96
 97        Returns:
 98            str: The text in the input.
 99        """
100        return self.text
101
102    def setTextChangedEvt(self, callback):
103        """
104        Set the callback function to be called when the text is changed/committed.
105
106        Args:
107            callback (callable): Function to be invoked with the new text.
108        """
109        self.callback = callback
110
111    def setFilterPattern(self, pattern: str):
112        """
113        Set a regular expression pattern that the text must match when committed.
114
115        Args:
116            pattern (str): Regex pattern as a string.
117        """
118        self.filter_pattern = re.compile(pattern)
119
120    @overrides(GUIElement)
121    def draw(self, view, screen):
122        """
123        Render the text input box, its text, caret, and outline.
124
125        Args:
126            view: The parent View instance.
127            screen (pygame.Surface): The surface to render the input onto.
128        """
129        # background
130        if super().isSelected():
131            c = super().getStyle()["background_color"]
132            pygame.draw.rect(screen, colorChange(
133                c, 0.4 if c[0] > 128 else 0.7), super().getViewRect(), border_radius=5)
134        else:
135            pygame.draw.rect(screen, super().getStyle()["background_color"], super().getViewRect(), border_radius=5)
136
137        # create subsurface for text (clipping)
138        surface = screen.subsurface(super().getViewRect())
139        text_offset = 0
140        caret_offset = 0
141        if len(self.text) != 0:
142            text_surface = self.font.render(
143                self.text,
144                1,
145                super().getStyle()["foreground_color"]
146            )
147            # calculate caret offset
148            caret_offset = self.font.size(self.text[0: self.caret_position])[0]
149            # offset for text
150            text_offset = max(caret_offset + 20 - super().getWidth(), 0)
151            if not super().isSelected():
152                text_offset = 0
153            # draw text
154            surface.blit(
155                text_surface, (5 - text_offset, (super().getHeight() - text_surface.get_height()) / 2)
156            )
157
158        # caret
159        if super().isSelected() and generateSignal(400):
160            x = 5 - text_offset + caret_offset
161            y = surface.get_height() * 0.2
162            pygame.draw.line(surface, super().getStyle()["foreground_color"], (x, y), (x, surface.get_height() - y), 2)
163
164        # outline
165        pygame.draw.rect(screen, super().getStyle()["outline_color"], super().getViewRect(), 2, border_radius=5)
166
167    @overrides(GUIElement)
168    def processEvent(self, view, event):
169        """
170        Handle Pygame events for text input focus, editing, and caret navigation.
171
172        Args:
173            view: The parent View instance.
174            event (pygame.event.Event): The event to process.
175        """
176        if event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
177            if inRect(event.pos[0], event.pos[1], super().getViewRect()):
178                super().select()
179                # Move caret to end on focus
180                self.caret_position = len(self.text)
181            else:
182                self.unselectTI()
183        elif event.type == pygame.KEYDOWN:
184            if super().isSelected():
185                if event.key == pygame.K_RETURN:
186                    self.unselectTI()
187                elif event.key == pygame.K_BACKSPACE:
188                    i = self.caret_position
189                    if i > 0 and len(self.text) > 0:
190                        # Remove char before caret
191                        self.text = self.text[:i-1] + self.text[i:]
192                        self.caret_position = max(0, self.caret_position - 1)
193                elif event.key == pygame.K_LEFT:
194                    self.caret_position = max(0, self.caret_position - 1)
195                elif event.key == pygame.K_RIGHT:
196                    self.caret_position = min(len(self.text), self.caret_position + 1)
197                else:
198                    # Insert new char at caret
199                    if hasattr(event, "unicode") and event.unicode in string.printable and event.unicode != '':
200                        i = self.caret_position
201                        self.text = self.text[:i] + event.unicode + self.text[i:]
202                        self.caret_position += 1
203
204    @overrides(GUIElement)
205    def update(self, view):
206        """
207        Update logic for the text input.
208
209        Args:
210            view: The parent View instance.
211        """
212        pass
213
214    def unselectTI(self):
215        """
216        Handle unselecting the text input, call text changed event, and validate filter if set.
217        """
218        if super().isSelected():
219            # text filter
220            if self.filter_pattern is not None:
221                if not self.filter_pattern.match(self.text):
222                    # clear text if invalid
223                    self.text = ""
224            if self.callback is not None:
225                self.callback(self.text)
226        super().unSelect()

189                    if i > 0 and len(self.text) > 0:
190                        # Remove char before caret
191                        self.text = self.text[:i-1] + self.text[i:]
192                        self.caret_position = max(0, self.caret_position - 1)
193                elif event.key == pygame.K_LEFT:
194                    self.caret_position = max(0, self.caret_position - 1)
195                elif event.key == pygame.K_RIGHT:
196                    self.caret_position = min(len(self.text), self.caret_position + 1)
197                else:
198                    # Insert new char at caret
199                    if hasattr(event, "unicode") and event.unicode in string.printable and event.unicode != '':
200                        i = self.caret_position
201                        self.text = self.text[:i] + event.unicode + self.text[i:]
202                        self.caret_position += 1

Handle Pygame events for text input focus, editing, and caret navigation.

Arguments:
  • view: The parent View instance.
  • event (pygame.event.Event): The event to process.

def unselectTI(self): 
214    def unselectTI(self):
215        """
216        Handle unselecting the text input, call text changed event, and validate filter if set.
217        """
218        if super().isSelected():
219            # text filter
220            if self.filter_pattern is not None:
221                if not self.filter_pattern.match(self.text):
222                    # clear text if invalid
223                    self.text = ""
224            if self.callback is not None:
225                self.callback(self.text)
226        super().unSelect()

class ToggleButton(SUILib.guielement.GUIElement): 
 42class ToggleButton(GUIElement):
 43    """
 44    Represents a toggle (switch) button UI element for SUILib applications.
 45
 46    The ToggleButton acts as an ON/OFF switch with an optional label. It supports
 47    custom styles, click callbacks, and integrates with the View layout system.
 48
 49    Attributes:
 50        label (Label): The label displayed next to the toggle button.
 51        status (bool): The ON/OFF state of the toggle.
 52        callback (callable): Function to call when the value (status) changes.
 53    """
 54
 55    def __init__(self, view, style: dict, text: str, status: bool = False, width: int = 0, height: int = 0, x: int = 0, y: int = 0):
 56        """
 57        Initialize a new ToggleButton instance.
 58
 59        Args:
 60            view: The parent View instance where this toggle button is placed.
 61            style (dict): Dictionary containing style attributes for the toggle.
 62                See config/styles.json for details.
 63            text (str): The text of the label next to the toggle.
 64            status (bool, optional): Initial ON/OFF state. Defaults to False (OFF).
 65            width (int, optional): Width of the toggle in pixels. Defaults to 0.
 66            height (int, optional): Height of the toggle in pixels. Defaults to 0.
 67            x (int, optional): X coordinate of the toggle. Defaults to 0.
 68            y (int, optional): Y coordinate of the toggle. Defaults to 0.
 69        """
 70        super().__init__(view, x, y, width, height, style)
 71        self.label = Label(view, super().getStyle()["label"], text, False, True)
 72        self.callback = None
 73        self.hover = False
 74        self.status = status
 75
 76    def setText(self, text: str):
 77        """
 78        Set the text of the toggle's label.
 79
 80        Args:
 81            text (str): New text for the label.
 82        """
 83        if self.label is not None:
 84            self.label.setText(text)
 85
 86    def getStatus(self) -> bool:
 87        """
 88        Get the ON/OFF status of the toggle button.
 89
 90        Returns:
 91            bool: True if ON, False if OFF.
 92        """
 93        return self.status
 94
 95    def getLabel(self) -> Label:
 96        """
 97        Get the Label object associated with this toggle.
 98
 99        Returns:
100            Label: The label instance.
101        """
102        return self.label
103
104    def setValueChangedEvt(self, callback):
105        """
106        Set the callback function to be called when the toggle value changes.
107
108        Args:
109            callback (callable): Function to be invoked with new status (True/False).
110        """
111        self.callback = callback
112
113    @overrides(GUIElement)
114    def draw(self, view, screen):
115        """
116        Render the toggle button (switch) and its label.
117
118        Args:
119            view: The parent View instance.
120            screen (pygame.Surface): The surface to render the toggle onto.
121        """
122        # Background and outline
123        if self.status:
124            bg_color = colorChange(super().getStyle()["foreground_color"], 0.8)
125        else:
126            bg_color = super().getStyle()["background_color"]
127        pygame.draw.rect(
128            screen,
129            bg_color,
130            super().getViewRect(),
131            border_radius=int(super().getHeight() / 2)
132        )
133        pygame.draw.rect(
134            screen,
135            super().getStyle()["outline_color"],
136            super().getViewRect(),
137            2,
138            border_radius=int(super().getHeight() / 2)
139        )
140        # Toggle switch handle
141        if self.status:
142            pos = super().getWidth() - super().getHeight() / 2
143            pygame.draw.circle(
144                screen,
145                super().getStyle()["foreground_color"],
146                (super().getX() + pos, super().getY() + super().getHeight() / 2),
147                super().getHeight() / 2
148            )
149        else:
150            pygame.draw.circle(
151                screen,
152                super().getStyle()["foreground_color"],
153                (super().getX() + super().getHeight() / 2, super().getY() + super().getHeight() / 2),
154                super().getHeight() / 2
155            )
156        # Label
157        if self.label is not None:
158            self.label.setX(super().getX() + super().getWidth() + 5)
159            self.label.setY(super().getY() + super().getHeight() / 2)
160            self.label.draw(view, screen)
161
162    @overrides(GUIElement)
163    def processEvent(self, view, event):
164        """
165        Handle Pygame events for toggle button interaction (click, hover).
166
167        Args:
168            view: The parent View instance.
169            event (pygame.event.Event): The event to process.
170        """
171        if event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
172            if inRect(event.pos[0], event.pos[1], super().getViewRect()):
173                self.status = not self.status
174                if self.callback is not None:
175                    self.callback(self.status)
176        elif event.type == pygame.MOUSEMOTION:
177            if inRect(event.pos[0], event.pos[1], super().getViewRect()):
178                self.select()
179            else:
180                self.unSelect()
181
182    @overrides(GUIElement)
183    def update(self, view):
184        """
185        Update logic for the toggle button.
186
187        Args:
188            view: The parent View instance.
189        """
190        pass

Represents a toggle (switch) button UI element for SUILib applications.

The ToggleButton acts as an ON/OFF switch with an optional label. It supports custom styles, click callbacks, and integrates with the View layout system.

Attributes:
  • label (Label): The label displayed next to the toggle button.
  • status (bool): The ON/OFF state of the toggle.
  • callback (callable): Function to call when the value (status) changes.
